64 ppmare assigned to Si atoms in the polar
icosahedral and dumbbell positions, respectively. With this
assignment, the tetrahedrally coordinated dumbbell Si attains a
chemical shift that is closer to that of the elemental structure,
whereas the six-coordinated Si appears more deshielded because
its electrons contribute to delocalized icosahedral bonding,
which in turn would result in a positively polarized nature. Both
signals are relatively broad, due to the
